newsitem.title: UK: Psion falls on concern over margins.
newsitem.headline: Psion falls on concern over margins.

text.p: Shares in hand-held computers firm Psion Plc fell on Monday after the company reported annual profits of 16.04 million stg but warned that margins were being hurt by the continued strength of the pound. The shares had fallen 22-1/2p to 410p by 0845 GMT.

Psion said group pretax profits, including exceptional items rose to 17.56 million stg compared with 11.65 million stg a year ago, slightly ahead of most analysts expectations. "The pretax number was better than we expected but people are worried about margins," said one industry analyst who declined to be named. The company said profitability in 1996 was not materially affected by the strength of sterling but the group's margins in 1997 were being hit. "Sales in the first few months of 1997 are well ahead of 1996 levels although margins are being impacted by the strength of sterling," said chairman David Potter in a statement accompanying the results.
